content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
												UPDATE::: The devs have seen it fit to immediately ban me from their discusson board after this review was posted. For that I warn folks who have issues to be careful speaking up. Seems this Dev likes their dirty tricks when they don't want their filthy laundry aired out.This is my final review edit. After enough time with four kings, I have decided they have completely lost touch with the fanbase who supported them from day one. Just as they did on playstion home for six long years.Im going to be honest here, I'm not liking the way things are going. I thought after they had their time with playstation home, we'd see changes that showed they learned their lesson last time from customer feedback. I remember a time when DL had a casino on ps home, it was an avitar social world with literally hundreds of mini games and places to chat and play. Game themed rooms and more. They also had a casino there and they did the same thing with chips there. The games there were PLAUGED with bugs and cheaters, very little was done. However they had no issue releasing an apartment for over 50 dollars that came with the same games you already had access to in their casino and they REFUSED to change the pricing even with such negative feedback. Oh and might I add, the people who were stupid enough to buy it lost those items anyway when ps home closed it's doors this past march.People lost thousands of chips with no rembursement, and the tournaments were a joke. You had to pay 4.99 for a tournament bracelet with no guarantee of any reward. Just a pat on the back for those who didnt make the cut, while they pocketed their real money.I was much happier with this game during EA. Now? Theyre making the game completely un fun by catering to the new players they want to spend money. Bingo nerfs are beyond terrible.Im now seated at a progressive game with over 25 players. The pot would usually be over 100k. It isn't even breaking 40k right now...and rp payouts are the same as the main floor games.The people who bought in during early access are being pushed away to cater to the casual player with a spending problem. I have taken a break from four kings and returned today to see if the nerfs were truly as bad as they say, I'm unhappy to report they are far worse than what players are complaining about. I remember sitting at bingo for hours, and not having this back of luck either. One could say it comes and it goes, but this is just ridiculous. I was quick to respond to a gent who made a post on how this game is not only exploiting potential gambling addicts, but nothing more than a cash grab. I really would like to recall that person's username, so I can apologize and say they might be right.Because the players who bought into this game and made is possible for it to even make it out of early access are being disregarded. If this is what developers plan to do to people who buy into their games in order to support a title, I am swearing off EA games entirely. Because this seems to be a NASTY habit with devs on here. They bend over backwards during EA, but after they get your money all bets are off.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2015
												I honestly downloaded this casino with low expectations. Especially after I started the game, entered my info and was expected to get a confirmation email that I had to use to verify myself. I never got it. So I tried logging into the casino anyway, and got in!So I created my avatar, got my initial set of quests, which involved going into the various parts of the casino to get free coins, which I did to humor the developers attempt at a psuedo-tutorial. Got my money and proceeded to try out the various casino games.The slot games were pretty good. I won reasonably enough but it was still a slow bleed of coins. Which I actually liked. It wasn't like Facebook slots where you lose everything in an hour, nor was it so generous that they were practically just free ATM machines. You won enough to keep playing, even some nice big wins and bonus games, and yet lost enough to keep it real.I then went to play some bingo. The buy-in was a bit pricey, but it was well designed and fun to play as well. Being a semi-senior citizen myself I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was at a good reasonable pace that I could keep up with four cards yet at a good enough pace to keep you daubing those numbers.Even though they have multi-player blackjack and poker rooms, I played some video poker and blackjack to get the feel of things there. The video blackjack was novel in that you played all 5 player slots against the dealer, and it was quite fun doing it that way. This was the ony time that I actually felt that the game was actually working against the players in that in playing around 30 hands the dealer never busted once, even when its face card was a 5 or 6, but I still won enough to play a good amount of time without feeling too cheated since I was playing 5 hands to its 1.Next I went to the video poker Jacks or Better machine which I personally felt was the one type of game where you can truly see how stacked the games are against players....and I was shocked....I don't even like video poker, but I ended up playing it for the next two hours. The odds were truly nearly perfect. I was even able to make a few inside straights, a handful of flushes on two card draws, and even keeping pairs of low cards was a reasonable and winnable strategy. It was a thing of beauty. An honest, true to the odds video poker game. When I looked up and it was after midnight on a work night and I had played two hours on a casino game that I truly hated I was sold.This is a good attempt at casino games, where their offerings are, at this point and time, honest and true to the odds, and actually pretty darn fun to play. I was truly shocked.The real money shop is very reasonably priced, even better than Facebook casino's and its very liberal about giving you free coins as you play.All in all I had a good time and was truly shocked that I did, and that I want to play again and try out other games. And I want to play more video poker...which I can't believe I'm actually saying....So yeah...Four Kings Casino is truly in a world of its own compared to other casino-type games out there, and if you're in the least bit interested in it then it's definitely worth downloading and checking out for yourself.

content:
Posted: November 9, 2015
												This is not your typical casino slot game, where you are playing all by yourself.  This is an MMORPG that happens to be set in a casino.  LIke regular casino slot games, it is expected that you will lose your chips, and be expected to buy more.  The Devs have created a nice variety of games, and are working to add more.  However, the major draw for this game is the player interaction.Now, like any MMORPG, you're going to have your bad apples, the players who just want to cause trouble.  But, on the whole, the players are a good group, and it is fun to interact with people from around the world.You also have the fun of creating your avatar, and buying various clothing options.  There are items available for real money, and also items available for RP - the reward points you earn when you win in the casino.Just don't expect the game to be something it's not, and expect to spend money on chips if you play a lot, and enjoy the aspects of the game that are truly exceptional.  Hope to see you there.

content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
												The game deserved better than a "Mixed" overall.    It's a 3D casino game with a bit of character customization. You can walk around, talk to other players, and lose all of your chips in a single hand of blackjack because you decided to hit on 17. It's good at what it does, and it's a shame that there aren't more games on Steam like this. WIth that out of the way, there are in fact, microtransactions, bugs, and space issues. All of these issues though, are not nearly as bad as people make them out to be. You never HAVE to buy chips in order to play. You are generously given chips frequently. Every 15 minutes you get 250. Logging in for the first time grants you 1000, and 500 for each subsequent day you log in. And finally, doing daily and weekly tasks, gives you chips. Trust me, you should have plenty of enough chips to start playing anything except for maybe Poker.   As for bugs, I personally have only encountered one. It's slightly annoying to join a table, only to freeze and be unable to do anything. That being said, that was literally only the first day of me playing. I haven't had that problem at all since. People complaining about "Dealers dealing to nonexistent people" are probably just having internet troubles. Now, the only REAL issue, is the lack of tables. There's tons of slot machines and plenty of seats in Bingo, but there's a huge issue with Blackjack and Poker tables being full constantly. I fully recommend this game for people that don't want to spend money on actually going to the Casino. It's a casual casino experience, and it's great at being that.

												I was very skeptical before I installed this, but turns out that I enjoy this game a lot. I've learned how to play craps (steam might censor that) from this game and the next time I go to our local casino I can actually play it with my buddy. This game features the following games;Baccarat (VIP room)Big Six WheelBlackjackBingoCrapsJacks or BetterKenoPokerRouletteSlots (4 Kinds)Video BlackjackVideo PokerWarAfter creating your character, you are placed inside a casino with 4 wings that branch off the main 2 floor lobby. If you get lost, you are provided with a map that allows for fast travel. The game starts you off with 20,000 chips and has verious ways to earn free chips should you find your self down on your luck. The game keeps track of stats for each game you play. There's a leader board for each game and global score that resets each month. There are daily and weekly tasks that grant additional chips. Also there's a lot of avatar customization that I won't get into. content:
Posted: February 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you are a true gambling person, you'll love this game.  If  like me you were looking for a fun  way to pretend to  gamble then  do not buy this game because once out of Early Access it could end up costing you a lot of money if you continue to play the game.  During Early Access you can earn small amounts of chips  (usually  25 chips at a time) for doing   several things like visiting certain area's of the casino, plus you can earn the same number of  chips  for every 15 minutes you spend in game.  When you  enter the Casino after purchasing the game you  are given 1000 chips.  My first love is  slots, so  I casually ran over to the slots and   after 10 spins  I'd spent  virtually all of my chips.   Thankfully, during the  Early Acess phase you can get more chips for   very little money; i.e.  there are several selections ranging from 500 chips to 40 000 chips each one of which  costs you $0.01 to purchase. This amount is deducted from your Steam wallet.   Once early access is over these will undoubtably change and cost much more.  Sadly, like any gambling den, the odds are always stacked against you.  After the 10 turns on the  slots, with virtually no chips left  and not wanting to wait around for  almost an hour before I could get  a couple  more spins, I left, then rejoined the following day because I was under the impression that during Early Access we would be given   1000 chips every  day, but this was not the case (I purchased the  basic game plus the cheaper of the dlc's, (costing me a total of just over £16).  I don't know whether   you can or will be able to convert  any winnings  to  real money, but even if you were, it's only a  lucky few that would ever manage to get any real money back.Personally I'm really disappointed with this game.  I was  hoping to be able to play a wide range of different slot machines,  but there was little  variety to be found, plus until I decided to buy the  highest  slection of chips I only had enough for two spins and  four goes on the roulette table (which has a minimum bet of 10 chips). Part way through my second visit there was a server reboot.  I was given literally a  minute's warning in which I was asked to log off.  As I was part way through a gamble  when this occured I wasn't    pleased. Despite it being in Early Access, so by definition  not a completed game, I can't recommend this game to anyone but   hardened gamblers.

												Finally, a well designed walk around casino for PC. Remember Ceasars Palace? That was a good game made 15 years ago and there hasn't been something similar until now. The Four Kings is a huge casino and you can walk up to any table/machine and play it. 10/10You start with 10k chips and can purchase 400k for $20. Call your friends up and play poker together with other people online.Yes, this game requires major computer resources as people are saying, so if you can't handle it turn them to low in the settings.

content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is probably one of the easiest games I've found to just hop on for an hour or so a day and just have some fun.The game is fairly well optimised after one of the latest patches, the game is now most certainly where it needs to be in terms of performace. The gameplay is so reliable and enjoyable, the only downside as many have said is the slots. Slots is the easiest game to sink money and time into and the current machine is rather lackluster. I'm aware a new machine is on it's way and that's what I'm most excited for.There is some issues with the games UI still and quite a few issues regarding the VIP system and everything relating that is rather confusing and not very well explained.The customisation of the characters is very strong and enjoyable, there is a lot of options regarding your style and the currency to buy items is a little hard to get however it's very rewarding when you finally get the item you have wanted.My biggest gripe is the VIP system and that is runs on a server based clock and if you manage to get VIP one day before the end of the month you get it for only that one day, then when the reset rolls around it clocks you back to normal status. Even if you purchased one of the dlc packs for a month of VIP it resets you to normal status when the monthly reset happens - so if you purchase it at a bad time you could only get 5 days of VIP or however long untill the month changes.This is a game I have been waiting for, and for a very long time. I am so glad it has finally come and it is so enjoyable. The updates are frequent however often not many new features as there is a lot of work to be done on the backend of the game and the new games etc take a very long time to produce. The payouts are balance, the game is fun, and the servers are fast.A great game in my opinion and I'm glad I bought into the beta before it went F2P because I got so much out of it. A must buy for any gambling enthusiast or card guys.

number of helpful: 9 of 11 people (82%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												It's simply a great game.I honestly don't really know why the reviews are 'Mixed' at the moments.The only way you can not like this game is that you either can't handle losing, you hate unfinished games or you somehow burn your money on this game. IF you are a person like that, than please don't start playing this game.I fell in love with this game. I love gambling games and especially the ones that don't force me to use real money and games that contain an entire casino in one game. The Four Kings does all of that and more.It is indeed possible to spend real money on this game and I have noticed that a lot of reviews are about this game being addictive and forcing you to spend real money. I am very much addicted to this game and love to play it, but this game does not make you spend real money. In most games you constantly get pop-ups with sales, deals et cetera. In this game, if you're willing to spend money on it, you'll actually have to search for a bit to find where to buy the chips. I like the way the developers have kind of hidden it so it didn't become tempting to do at all.It's a casino. It's gambling. Of course, you can lose and it will always feel like you lose more than you win. If you are a person that can't handle that than just don't play this game. Whatever you do, don't blame this game for the way your personality doesn't match with it. I've done some translating for this game and I know how hard the people behind this game are still working their asses off to improve it. I've played this game since the first day it was available and I still can't believe how fast it improved in a little more than a year. It was really crappy at the start and had a lot of bugs which are nearly all fixed. More slot games have been added and I've also seen they are working on a bowling alley which I personally can't wait for to see in the game.This game is far from perfect, but I fell in love with it and am able to accept and ignore the flaws it has.I can definitely not recommend this game for everyone out there since I know there are some people on this planet that really really can't handle losing. Fortunately I haven't seen much of these people within the community and I'd personally love to keep it that way and probably a lot of players with me.If you're reading this and you haven't tried the game yet. Just do it. Try it, and if it's not your thing just quit and come back after a few months. Your view will have changed and you'll appreciate it more than before.You'll meet a bunch of new people, it's fun to play with friends and above all: it's free.Try it out. You won't regret.

How's that even possible? Every single time I hit on 12-13 I bust, when dealer hits, it's a 21.I've been playing BJ and frequenting casinos more than seven years, and believe me, I've never seen a shameless blatantly cheating BJ like this.Video BJ is weird though, I presume devs forgot to fix that machine, nearly %60 of the time dealer busts.Video Poker? 												I would say this is one of the best free casino games I've played. I've been playing it a lot (on ps4 so I can play with my friend, which is why my hours are low on steam), and you don't ever have to spend any real money on it, you can win plenty of money yourself, I have over 200k ingame cash on the ps4 version from mostly poker and bingo games and I never spent a real-life dime on this game. I'm not even that great at poker. Pros:-Solid gameplay-You can earn lots of ingame money with skill and a little luck without paying real money-Devs push out frequent updates-Opportunities to regain cash when broke like free poker and free bingo games (plus they slowly give you 250 credits every so-often)-Full controller support-Chill music-Customizable avatars with emotes so I can be a creepy old man and dance on the bingo stageCons:-Community reminds me of PS Home in the sense that youve mostly got silent players, people who are trolling for fun (which I'm fine with c:), and those small groups that usually consist of mostly girls and maybe one guy who all have no sense of humor, have been playing this game forever, and are rude to anyone they don't know. This game is a lot more fun if you bring some friends.-Makes me feel like a senior citizen and I'm not sure how I feel about that.-Animations and character models sit on the line of laughably bad and just actually bad-User interface (mostly start menu and avatar customization menus/shop menus) are incredibly ugly and shop menus are barely functional at times (this doesnt matter if you don't care about clothes)If you want to play poker/bingo/blackjack/roulette/etc with internet friends on a semi-frequent basis, and you don't want to play a browser game, this is a good free option.

Early Access Review
								If you are a gambling person, you will love this game. I spoke with one of the developers today and I can truly say they are putting in their best efforts to improve this game. An update is being installed as I type. I entered the casino and I must say, everything is quite self-explanatory. After playing a few spins on the roulette table I ran into a member of the dev-team and had a nice conversation. I have been looking for a game like this for AAAGES. But two weeks ago I searched yet again for a decent casino game on steam, and only a bit later, this comes out. It is truly amazing and heading in the good direction.Yes, there may be bugs and things may not be as "smooth" as one would like, but keep in mind that this game is still in development. I bought the all-in package and I am glad I did. I wonder if it will be ever possible to turn your 'earnings' into real money, since you can buy additional chips in the game with real currency. Anyway this game is really a must-have if you love gambling. This is the first time I have ever written a decent review on a steam game. On a game in general, I think. But let me tell you once again: It. Is. Worth. It. The variety of games to play is good. There's blackjack, single-deck 21, craps, keno, hold 'em poker, roulette, PuntoBanco/Baccarat, slot machines and some kind of "Wheel of fortune". There is also a VIP-area which allows you to play at tables with higher stakes, which makes it possible to either win more - or loose more - being able to change your bet more to your liking. You can also sit on a bench and do some emotes while talking, this adds to the real-life atmosphere. I will keep a close eye on the development of this game!>went to blackjack table> bet $1.000>Double down at 16>5>2110/10 would double down again on high numbers.

content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
												 Digital Leisure and i go back a while.  About 2 years or more to be more exact.  So, back then, and even earlier, there was this thing called Playstation Home, and it was a place where you could play games, watch videos on new game/movie releases, meet people, socialize, and do other things as well.  It was an amazing place and the best part was just how you could be what you wanted to be, although some times it did have a price tag on it, and have fun.  One of the many companies I remembered was DL.   They were well known for having their Casino hub, and a lot of people liked them for it.   Now, back then, I was able to play as well, and although I spent more money than I would like to admit, I did have fun and once you got to a certain tier/level, you never had to worry about losing too much money because you just had to play smart and not be an idiot.Well that was nice and all but PSH was shutdown because Sony wasn't making enough money or something and all that money we spent, went bye bye.   Now, back to the present.  We have this Casino game, back up and free to play, and it has the same feel as the other casino did.   So my review is biased slightly because I really loved it back then and am happy to see it now.   Due to that, I will keep the review part, short and brief.Pros:Has many different gambling games and slotsNice way to customize your avatar in terms fo looksrewards for winning things or achieving thingsways to earn free chips so you can still playMuch much cheaper prices for chips than when it was on PSHVisuals are pretty butCon:Visuals are pretty, but if you put on max or near max, then you will lag, badly.  Its just not that well optimzied but who cares, its all about the gambling, not the visualsEasy to lose money fast if you don't know what you are doingOverall, this is very much like how Home was but with a few changes that make it nice.   And yes you can still dance in front of people and be a weirdo.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9
												Oh, I have such a love/hate relationship with this game. lolTHE UPSIDE: In terms of playability, it is probably the best casino simulator out there. The graphics look great, the games are a blast, and they start you off generously, while also occasionally giving you chips here and there based on little side tasks you can complete, so that you're never completely out of chips. The games list consists of Bingo, Craps, Blackjack, Poker, Roulette, War, Big Wheel, Keno, Slots, and even Bowling!There is a social club, though I never really see anyone in there. You can chat with others, customize a personal avatar, and win points to buy more customizable options for them (clothes, accessories, etc). Not many people actually chat when I'm there (usually late evenings), but when you do strike up a conversation, usually while getting ready for a poker game, I've found some really nice people there.THE DOWNSIDE:Cash. Cash Cash Cash. Like most free to play games, there are options to buy chips (and even some extra accessories you can't buy with points). Now, the prices are actually not unreasonable. As of this review, 99 cents gets you 5,000 chips. $4.99 will get you 50,000 chips. I guess it's just my issue with spending real money in order to try and win fake money, and that you can lose your fake money really quickly if you're not careful, just like real gambling. Granted, if you lose 50,000 chips, you've lost $5 (and it might be a good, cheap lesson for those of you who gamble this way in real life), it's just there's no way to recoup that in any real way.So I guess that's more of a personal drawback. Some folks don't mind paying a couple of bucks here and there, and in all honesty, if you can spare $5 every so often I guess it's not that big of a deal. I mean, there are games where you pay $5 and $10 for extra minutes of game time, or extra power-ups that disappear in a handful of moves, so maybe there's more to it than I'm relaying here.FINAL THOUGHT:This game is a lot of fun. The games feel authentic, the atmosphere makes you feel like you're in Vegas, and to be honest there aren't many options left for those of us who like to gamble without spending real piles of money. All in all, I do recommend this game.

If you are looking for a fun casino experience with devs who moderate chat, and care about their game I'd suggest http://www.casinorpg.com. While not as pretty as The Four Kings, the community, and game play is years ahead. Overall Rating: 2 of 5Click here for full review: http://www.ragetrip.com/2015/06/the-four-kings-casino-and-slots-f2p.html

content:
Posted: April 14, 2016
												While there are many friendly people on the network, the suspicion that the odds have been stacked in the house's favor makes the game an overall unenjoyable experience.Playing over 10 hours of blackjack following standard basic strategy outlined by wizardofodds.com, my average losses were roughly 50,000 chips an hour. This puts the house edge of blackjack at over 10%, which in no variation of game rules is reasonable. Sitting at any table game will cause nothing but frustration for you, or the players beside you. It's no surprise that the only game played by the regulars is poker, which is played against other players, not the house.If you choose to play this game, play it for the social experience, not for the excitement that a fair casino offers. There will not be enough enjoyment to justify the time, energy, and money you dump into the game.While I have enough chips in my account to bleed out for the next six months, I have instead decided to uninstall this game in favor of more fruitful pursuits. Social experience: 9/10Gambling experience 2/10

content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								Four Kings Casino is probably the best simulated casino style multiplayer game to date. Most typical casino games are present and the play style is that of an mmo with customizable avatars ect allowing you to navigate the realistic virtual casino setting and join the different games as you choose. Gameplay is very similar to the Digital Leisure casino that was part of playstation home, for those that played that, only graphically better. Bugs have been minimal over the several hours I've played so far and the game is pretty polished for the first few days of early access beta. I would definitely recommend this game for casual players who enjoy both casino style gaming and social mmo type game mechanics. My only caveat is that this game is not strictly a free to play game, but after its offical launch will be a microtransaction model wherein you have the option of  purchasing additional casino chips to augment or replenish your current holdings. As with any game of this nature the inherent cost will depend on what you decide to spend, so amongst those gamers who inexplicably expect to enjoy playing polished multiplayer games without having to financially support them I'm sure there will be complaining.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2015
												The game is a combination of Second Life and a common Casino Game. I like the idea and I think the developers' execution is well done. Using a laptop with HD3000 chip, I cannot rate the graphics.Plus:- The diversity of casino games is very good and even better than the average casino-only games.- The socializing is eased as a HUD is implemented similar to MMORPGs with some default mimics (Dance, Say Hello, Wave the hand, ...).- Easy start with start chips and the support through chip income with daily quests. If you do not want to spend hours on gambling, than I think it should be enough.Neutral:- The execution time of the casino table games is poor. It is onlz neutral, as the developer have to ensure that all players are on the same level all the times. But in a real live casino, the execution is mind blowing contrary to this game.- The party room seems unecessary, as there is never one in it. On first sight, this room also does not provide any benefit or interesting spot.- 3 Minutes to wait when all players are there to start a round of Bingo? That's far too high!Minus:Basically the casino consists of 5 rooms (hopefully I counted correctly). However, each room is only accessible via a loading screen. I think this concept is too much outdated to give here any possibilty for an excuse. The casino is not the Venetian and I think the level should be loadable within one go.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2016
												Been playing this for a handful of months now. You should have no problem being able to gamble and hang with friends without buying chips if you know how to play the games.  Also if you don't over bet based on the amount of chips you have.  It has 3 different slot games, Video Poker, Video BJ, multiple deck BJ and single handed BJ (in VIP lounge), Texas Hold em, Keno, War, Roulette, Craps, Bingo, Big 6 Wheel, and Baccarat. The game has events on the weekends (same 4 that repeat), daily tasks (quests if you will), and weekly tasks.  The leaderboards reset every 3 months (considered seasons) and I believe there are rewards at the end of each season depending on where you rank in each game and global. On the downside, there are gliches which is to be expected.  They patch probably once a month, sometimes twice.  There are people that shouldn't be on the game much less within the social/online community like anywhere. Easily can be blocked though.  If you enjoy messing around with gambling then you would probably enjoy this game.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2016
												Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!This is a Gambling game.Interface/Menu/Settings. You need to make an account for this game in order to play. This game is totally for free, however you are able to buy stuff with money.You can play window mode or fullscreen.There is alot of resolution sizes.The sound and music volume has a slidebar.You are able to change controls.You can play this game with a xbox controller. With vibration toggle mode.About the game.You play with a 3D Character which you are able to customize. You can even unlock new clothes and tools. You can change Gender/Clothes/effects at any time you wish.The game can only be played in online mode. You are able to level up in activities. For whatever reason it is.You are able to compete other players in some gambling modes.You are able to add "Timestamp" in the chat window.You can use emotes.There are alot of different Gambling modes in the game.Casino slot machinesBingo (My favourite)BlackjackPokerRouletteWarAnd some other activities.However sometimes it feels that the game is a little too unfair and makes you lose many or multiple times.On the other hand, Casino's never were fair even in real life.Every 15 minutes you will get 250 chips for free, however these will not stack (which means you have to collect them). You will also NOT receive the free chips if you are offline. You will only get them if you are online in the game.You are able to complete tasks to get some more Chips or even clothes.  There are daily and weekly tasks.Other things.There are leaderboards for certain Casino games.There are alot of immature people or people that are offensive and swearing.Alot of people do not want to sit next or close to someone else. They prefer to sit in the middle, or having 1 sit next to them empty or they sit entirely alone.The game is sort of addictive, Not because it's a "Gambling" Game. But more it's easy to play and easy pick and leave game. Time goes fast too.Game is Pay to lose. Literally, You lose more then win. You pay real life money to get chips and you spend them in the casino to lose again without making a profit. -------------------I Give this game a 6/10

content:
Posted: August 19, 2015
												The game itself is nice.  I enjoy the real casino vibe it carries.  Almost all of the social aspects of the game fall totally flat.  Like your complimentary apartment, and the dance club.  There are zero reasons to go there.  I walked around the apartment and you can't do anything except sit on things.  I didn't even notice any customizable aspects to it.  Pros. Real Casino simulator in how you walk around and play the games.  Seems like most of the games simulate real life fairly well based on my experience with those games.  Poker is always agaisnt players so it is the "fairest", although it falls victim to all fake money poker games out there.Cons.Blackjack.  Holy crap... the blackjack. This game however is totally broken.  The dealer draws to 20 and 21 an INSANE amount of times.  It regularly draws to 20 and 21 with 5 and 6 showing.  The worst cards it can get.  The dealer also ends up with 20+ so often that you simply can't win even a 30 minute sitdown of basic BJ play.  I have played basic BJ rules, and in real life you can expect losing streaks of up to around 6 hands in a row.  More then that gets mathmatically inplausable, although 7 or even 8 could technically happen if you played for long periods of time.  This game however has gone on multiple 10+ hand losing streaks.  I have seen three 10 hand losing streaks in the last 2 days alone and Iv only dared play it a handful of times.  These happen in less then 20 minutes of playing.  The odds of this happening should be impossible, but it happens regularly.  10 unwinnable hands in a row when you play basic BJ.   I always play solo at the table to exclude any player errors.  Do NOT play BJ in this game.  Unless you are only going to play 3 or 4 hands and pray for a win.  But for real long term tight play, its useless.

content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								Four Kings Casino is the re-incarnation of the PS Home casino on PC (for now). A PS4 version is planned for the future. I must admit I was skeptical at first. Partly because I am not much of a gambler. But I wanted to be able to give our readers at yourpshome.net an insight as to what it was all about. Guess what? I got sucked in :) First of all, I was surprised at just how far this project has come along. I expected a very tiny begining and was amazed the first time I signed on that a whole casino was in front of me complete with a VIP room and a Club to party in. Now a nice "hotel room" (personal space) has been added which means the groundwork has been laid for future expansion. I orinally intended to just use the "free" or "beta" version, but it only took one visit to make me want to upgrade to an "All-In" pass. Well worth it. So even if you are not a die-hard gambler, you might still want to check this out. This isn't a Home replacement but its the best I've seen so far. Check it out. Who knows what the future holds?

												Great time waster. I really didn't expect to have much fun with this game and thought it was going to be really geared towards spending your money. The devs made it incredibly easy to enjoy this game without spending a dime. You get free chips regularly, every 15 minutes or so, there's multiple free daily things to get chips (poker, slots) and some of the jackpots you can hit pay out tons. If you are inclined to spend money on this game it's incredibly cheap, I was actually surprised at how little they charge for chips, cosmetic items are really the only thing with a mention worthy price tag. Devs are on regularly and actively listening to feedback and bug reports. It also has a really large community for being out for a whole two days. I can only see this becoming more enjoyable.If you enjoy gambling but you're a cheap ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, this game is for you.

number of helpful: 14 of 25 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
												I really wanted to like this game. I'm a big fan of casino games in general. I don't gamble much in real life, but it's nice to be able to have fun with little expense. Unfortunately, this game didn't really fit the bill.  From a social aspect, it's fine. Most of the people are nice. The rest of the game though, is severely lacking.  Poker has the same problem it has anywhere else. It's free. People still make boneheaded calls and go all-in with nothing.  The bigger problem is that the only tournament you can play is with 6 people at one table. You start with $50k which would be fine if the blinds didn't go up extremely fast. It makes trying to play a realistic game of poker virtually impossible, as very soon after starting you're pretty much pot committed once you bet anything.Blackjack is probably the best part of the game though, especially after the last update, it literally feels like the dealer is getting 20 or 21 every other hand. Still, there is money to be made if you know how to play.That brings me to the worst part of the game, table machines. Slots, keno, video blackjack and video poker are money suckers with what seems like much lower payout percentages than even Vegas. I literally sat there for 30-45 minutes without a single bonus round. Forget trying to bet anything higher than the minimum because you will soon be out of money.  There are only three types of slot machines which gets old really fast especially when none of them pay.  Keno has a minimum bet of $100 and video blackjack has a minimum of $200. With poor payouts, again you will be out of money quickly.  The game also has war, roulette, big wheel, craps and bingo which are all pretty standard.  Again, especially with war, it seems like the more money bet, the lower percentage of times you're going to win.You have daily tasks to do, receiving $200 for each of the 6. Unfortunately, most of the time you will be spending more than that to complete the tasks. There are weekly tasks, mostly revolving around getting a certain amount of XP. An example of the problem with this is me spending 45 minutes playing a $400 per spin slot machine, losing 40k and gaining a whopping 200xp. That would have been great if the weekly task wasn't 1,000 XP with a few thousand reward for doing so.  There is a VIP section for high rollers but I honestly don't know how people get to be high rollers unless they have spent real money or gotten extremely lucky. Again, I really wanted to like the game. Unforunately, there is better poker to be had on any online site and the rest of the game is just no fun with the extremely low payouts.  If you're just in it for the social aspect and don't mind betting small, go for it. Otherwise, I'd stick with other products.

number of helpful: 16 of 29 people (55%) found this review helpful7 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
												I constantly feel like the blackjack tables are stuck in a cheating loop. On 5 seperate occassions, I've seen the dealer get a king of hearts and a king of spades, 10 times in a row. I recorded some of its hands to see what they were like, its starting hand was never below 15 and somehow (despite only having a 13% chance to do so) it would consistently pull a 5 or a 6 to get a 20 or 21. The dealer in Four Kings gets a 20+ more than half of the time after 30 hands and most of those are a starting pair of 10 value cards.  The chances of these things happening aren't impossible, but for my first example, you would literally be more likely to pick an atom in your house at random and then accidently pick it again. And this somehow happened 5 times, if that's not cheating then I must have a luck of about 1 or 2 because I have lost over 100k chips to the blackjack tables.

content:
Posted: April 17
												I throughly enjoy this game. that being saidI disagree with whatever programming that is used for single player blackjack. What doesn't make since is that shoe play seems to favor the player more than single deck play, which is extraordinarily false in real life. There is no way to be sure the dealer is not simply rearranging the cards at any time to convenience the dealer and screw the player.Dealer dealt 20 or 21 greater than 50% of the time. Most of your double downs will be dealt a tiny card. Basic strategy is of little use since you will almost always be dealt a 10 with a 12-16 pat hand.One other thing I noticed. If you bet the smallest amount, you tend to win more than 50% of the time. If you start betting big, you will lose more than 80% of the time. Again, if you bet big, the computer can simply program the deck however it sees fit to win all the time. The programming of this game will just deal the dealer a 21 whenever the player trys to bet large. I've seen the dealer be dealt at least 5 times in a row before. Would never ever happen in real life to the dealer. Because no one would play.Additionally, at least 30-40% of the time, the dealer will draw to perfectly match your hand or beat your hand by one. while frusterating and not a big deal, it ONLY occcurs when you sway from the basica strategy while trying to mess up the card order so the dealer doesn't auto matically hit to a 21. Ex: you're dealt a 13 against a dealer up 6. Basica strategy says to stand, however when hitting you will always either be dealt a 10, or if you are dealt a small card, let's say a 4 (to a total of 17) - the dealer will either have an Ace in the hole (17 to push) or will draw perfectly to 18 (not 19-21, only to 1 above your pat hand).Don't spend really money on this game. It encourages the developers to try and take it even more so by instilling these unfair game mechanics.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2016
												The game allows you fair enough opportunities at the chance of free chips, as long as you play smart and conservative you'll never feel as though your forced to pay real money for them. I wish more developers realized this as games like this one depend on a active population. Still at times the population seems lacking in both the Bingo and Poker rooms. Bingo where the amount of people playing the game effects the jackpot and Poker where you have to sit at a table and wait for others to join. However this maybe different in the VIP section, as I write this I have not made it that far. As Casino games go I feel that this is a decent one. It comes with a few bells and whistles with tournaments, leader baords and character customization.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 13, 2015
												I've been enjoying Four Kings. It reminds me of Second Life or Sony Home - with that kind of last decade feel - but fun nonetheless.The machines are quite lacking in graphics, interface, and variety. Your average Facebook slots are light years better. Daily quests are mildly fun to complete. Avatar customization is average but okay. The table games and bingo are the most fun, with the social aspect and decent interfaces.I like this kind of game - and I wish someday there's a modern version that doesn't feel like I'm back in 2005.

I am digging it!

content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
												Editing my review of this game completely as things have changed a lot since I wrote my first review and second edit.The game is a lot less buggy than it was. It still sometimes kicks people from the table or game but it's leaps and bounds better than it was. All and all this is my favourite online poker playing game so I would recommend this to anyone who wants to play poker but don't want to pay money for it. (I also like to gamble with black jack, but poker is why I keep coming back to this game). The avatar simulation, in-game chat and community is also very nice and adds to the realism of it all. Different clothing for the avatar is also a pretty fun touch to the experience. I'd give this game 9.5/10

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 20, 2015
												OK time to review this game. I'll give it an nine point one. Fun bingo games that overall pay the best. I'm a pretty fair craps player. I play passline with odds and the come with odds but I swear craps kicks my♥♥♥♥♥ I can't figure this out. I'll Have to go back with a system I guess and try again. Overall the game is a blast and it is cool to walk up to a chick and ask her to dance. Most of the time they don't know how to react. Just don't harrass them, please.Machine play is pretty normal give and take, I still have not hit a straight!  Good fun and you can spend a few bucks without breaking the bank. Lots of table games that are fun. If you can coerce an invite to the Vip club it gives you a 24 hour pass. That brings with it a Baccarat game and some serious minimums on the other table games. High rollers only (or you can just hang out and see how the other half lives) lol!Have a little fun, don't get your undies in a bunch. It's just clean fun.Hope Digital continues to improve the solid product that they have.P.S. If you bingo, a must have is the $4.95 Auto Marker. You can kick back and watch the numbers come in all marked for you. On the longer games you can wander off, have a smoke, vacuum the living room, etc. come back and presto... all of your cards are marked! Way cool. And I'm not a shill for the Devs. Just tryin' to help! Please don't think I'm trying to sell♥♥♥♥♥♥ You get the marker you'll love itPPS I hit a straight tonite! celebration time.PPPS I won on bingo 50000 last nite and 26000 today. Am I on fire or what?

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2015
												From one of the old 'big dogs' of Playstation Home, Four Kings is a solid casino title, with a lot to offer, but a fair few minor flaws.  I haven't tested every single title, but after spending a chunk of time on several, I can say the following:Pros:A good set of titles that all function well; poker is of course only as good as the players you get, but all the basic functionality and pomp is here, combined with the daily tasks and tier increases that made PS Home attractive for folks like me.  It is, in essence, a wide array of gambling options with level ups and leveling bonuses.  That's kind of awesome.Regular influx of chips.  Playing for free long-term is entirely possible due to getting a decent chunk of chips for free from a number of resources (daily super slots, daily/weekly tasks for more chips, 250 chips every 15 minutes in game), which keeps the title from feeling locked off to any reasonable extent.Looks great.  Not Skyrim-with-a-million-graphics-mods great, but there's obviously been a lot of work to make the Four Kings look interesting, like the kind of place you could go for a vacation.ConsLack of counter of autoplay.  This is a minor quibble but it does frustrate.  I like to play the machine game 'Instant Keno', and it's a bit annoying that when I select the autoplay option that until it gets to the final play, I have no visual indicator how many runs I have left.Wasted space.  I love the nightclub and the apartment!  They look great, and again bring me back to what I liked about Playstation Home.  Except, they have no purpose at present.  The nightclub has the same music as the rest of the game.  The DJ booth, the bars, all have no interactivity.  The apartment is arguably worse, in that while it looks lovely, there's no way to interact with anything in this allegedly personal space, not even the televisions that look for all the world like they SHOULD be interactive.  I don't want these spaces excized, mind you; it helps to separate the title from generic casino titles in a similar vein, but all of the above needs SOME measure of interaction.  Mini-games, additional places to spend chips/RP/etc, looping videos, new music, I don't care what.  But for it to be lacking all of that makes it little more than window dressing.Limited spending options.  At present, chips let you play games, winning gives you RP, which can be used to buy a SMALL handful of avatar items, and if you earn X amount in a single month, you get VIP access for a month.  And... that's it.  Can't upgrade your apartment, avatar options are super limited, no special entertainment options for expending RP, etc, etc.  I hope this changes, as there's a lot of room here for enhancement of the overall experience beyond the casino games (which, again, work great and are decently diverse).Overall, the game is a recommend.  Yes, it has flaws, and I hope to see the title expand a LOT.  But what is there right now is a complete gambling title with solid gameplay in a good environment with countless options for snagging more chips for free and getting your fix on for the day.  And for an entry price of free, it's hard not to say give it a shot.

content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is everything it promises. A classy casino with traditional casino games, a VIP lounge, hotel rooms, poker tables, with more planned.Pros___-Realistic games, from periodically shuffling the deck in blackjack, to the betting ranges and free spins with a massive amount of lines to hit on within the slot machines, the games have a nice, realistic feel to them.-Population is currently rising, making this community driven game even more fun.-Awkward Dancing .Cons___-Currently, the variety for slots and machine games is limited. The devs DO, however, have intentions to implement more slot machine varieties as well as other games.-Some interface issues. Poker in particular has some issues which makes the game less smooth to play, such as all-in not showing the amount all-in'd for.The devs are dedicated, and often hang out in the game talking to the players. I got to talk with one of the developers about the future of the game, and there's a couple of things to look forward to.- The Event Room. The future of this room will hold random events, and potentially be used to play games not currently in the casino.- Free to play access. While playing in development is fun, and will translate into in-casino rewards upon release, this game will eventually be free to play. You can hop on with some buddies and hit the virtual casino for a night.This game is what it promises ; A multiplayer casino with realistic games to play with friends.

number of helpful: 8 of 14 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								An interesting hybrid between an MMO and a Facebook casino game, Four Kings adds a social element that is missing from those games. Reminds me a bit of the long since cancelled This is Vegas but multiplayer. In this state, there is a lot of variety in the different types of casino games, even if they suffer from the major population issue mentioned below. But at least it isn't just limited to a few of them. Best part is that you don't have multiple spam messages all along your Facebook wall from your parents trying to get chips from you.Game runs fine on my machine at least and save for one period where I had issues loading the character customizer, everything is fine on a technical standpoint.The only thing holding the game back is its lack of players, which due to the social nature of the game seriously harms the game even in this Early Access state. Hopefully once it launches people will give it a look. Maybe if Digital Leisure adds crafting and zombies, people will play it. :)Some suggestions to the developer for release and beyond:Figure out some reason for people to use the nightclub, whether its a drink-serving minigame to earn chips or something else worthwile. Seems useless at this point in time. Same with the Hotel Room. I'd love a GTA style TV where you watch pre-made shows but that's way too expensive for this kind of indie development studio. A possible area for user-generated content perhaps?More slot and video blackjack variations.Poker and Blackjack tournaments.

content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
												The Four Kings Casino And SlotsNot the worst free casino game I've ever played. F2P with chips and vanity items for sale with real money. Free 250 chips every 15 minutes. Mediocre customization compared to 80% of games on the market. The deciding factor for me was that although I get 250 chips every 15 minutes, buy-ins and minimum bets are much too high. 50 chips for a hand of war, 5000 chips for a sit and go 6 man poker game (besides the once-a-day freebie poker table), 200 per hand of video poker? I also couldn't find the payout table for the slot machine but that might just be a PEBKAC error. They really need to add about 3 floors to their casino with different stake levels on each floor. Currently not a recommendation but if they make the stakes lower so you can choose to play for fun and socializing instead of topping leaderboards I might change it.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2016
												I've been playing this game since the reviews on steam were "Mixed". I am very happy to see they have been upgraded to "mostly positive". This game delivers what it promises at a price that cannot be beat. I understand in the beginning there may have been technical issues, and its true the graphics may not be fully optomized, however this seems to have been resolved.  The games in the casino are fair. If you see reviews indicating the dealers are crooked, or the games are rigged: ignore them. They are written by ignorant players who are unaware that ALL games in a casino are slanted to the houses favor. The casino offers many games of chance, some with better odds than others. The blackjack is extremely liberal with a house edge of around .3%. Single Deck Blackjack is available in the VIP lounge which actually has a NEGATIVE house edge. The only real negative i can admit to is the fact that it is free to play and that attracts some pretty childish trolls. You can block them. I like to berate them. I find added enjoyment there, but you may find frustration.Oh, and if your table freezes while you have chips on the table, just report it. You will typically get a refund the next day.9/10 , would like to see more games, but very satisfied with what is available.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
												PC Specs (If you care):~Alienware 15 R2 LaptopIntel Core i7 6700HQ CPU @ 2.6 ghz Turbo Boosted at 3.5 ghz, 4 Cores, 8 Logical Processors8gbs RAMNvidia Geforce GTX 970MWindows 10 Home~The Four Kings Casino and Slots is what the title says it is, a casino. It's a third person online casino where you can make friends, customize your character and  play casino games like slots, blackjack, and poker. It has a chips system and everything for you to be immersed into the game and feel as if it's a real casino. Let's get right down to the aspects of the game and how they work really well with it.~Pros:-Great Graphics-Alot of Casino Games to Chose From-Multiplayer -Nice CommunityCons:-Buggy-Insane FPS Drops (Occasionally)-Unfair Dealers (More Below)~Clearing up the Microtransactions:    You might automatically turn this game down because you've heard about microtransactions. Whatever you do, don't do that thing that I just said. You CAN but are not FORCED to buy chips with real money. It is COMPLETELY OPTIONAL and you can get chips from playing the games, waiting 15 minutes for your free 200 chips, getting your daily chips, doing your daily or weekly tasks. I just listed off 4 ways you can get chips do you realise how UNNESSASARY buying chips is. If you complain abut the buying of chips just stop it.~Unfair Dealers:    I've heard many people talk about the unfair dealers and I too have experienced it. In Blackjack when you're playing the dealer will seem very unfair at times. Lets say me and the dealer are against each other and I get a 12 and I hit, I'll automatically get a 22. Lets do this again, I get a 4 the dealer has a 17, I hit and get 7 he hits and gets 21. Where's the equality? This happens alot of times and I lost 2,000 chips to this happening many times in a row. It seems as if when you play with more people the dealer becomes more fair though.~Games:-Many different types of slots-Bingo-Blackjack-Poker-Video Blackjack-Jacks or Better-KenoOverall this game has some great potential and I'm glad that this is a thing. I highly recommend it to anybody who likes casino games alot.7/10

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												I went into this game expecting total♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ but it's actually surprisingly fun. Especially with friends.You get to customize a character, you have your own hotel room, the environments are beautiful, and the games are pretty damn entertaining. I expected to have microtransactions shoved down my throat at every turn, but the starting money is generous and unless you really suck at gambling, it's hard to lose those starting funds (free chips every 15 minutes, free bingo games, chips lying around the casino, and dailies/monthies help earn anything lost back as well). Only other transactions were minor and completely optional, mostly cosmetic.I don't have many complaints, honestly. I hope to see this game grow and improve, as there's plenty of ways they can expand the experience. I might actually put money into the game purely to support the model they have going. Keep up the good work, guys.In short: 10/10 would make friends ragequit by beating their♥♥♥♥♥at bingo again.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7
												A free game with paid optional content but you don't really need to pay since you get free chips every 1/2 an hour, free chips for doing tasks and if even free chips to use just floating around the rooms. Good PointsPretty much entirely free to play and no need to pay anything.The game or games are fun. All poker games are here: blackjack, poker, bingo, craps, bowling (coming soon), war and even virtual games like slots. You can play with others or use a virtual game to play alone. The 6 rooms are very big and spacious (7 if you have vip) and you can customise your character for free; with a few options as paid only.VIP is like membership you can buy, but if you're good at the game you can earn it for free by pure skill. Your progress will be shown in the menus. Talking about them, it can be a bit fiddly to use but easy enough to understand, the options, social, character customisation and features are all here.Bad PointsOnly BAD POINTS are sometimes the menu's can glitch out when playing a game. Doesn't affect the game at all and you can play without any problem; the most common problem is bingo as it doesn't show the pattern you're doing, but the in-game world shows it on the screens and you can look around in any game so not a huge problem; just annoying.OverallNot a bad game, it's gambling sure but unlike most it doesn't force you to pay anything and you can have fun playing for free. If you want to pay you can but it's not required to play. They did an amazing job creating the games and worlds; each game looks unique and I keep finding myself coming back for more! The best part, I'm not loosing any real money betting! Hooray!

content:
Posted: June 20, 2016
												Very addicting if you like casino games, and not a bad interface even if all you want to do is play poker with other players. The game is often populated with lots of players, and being able to control an avatar character in the community is highly enjoyable.December 2016 expanded edit:I still love this game, and it's nice to chill out in. It's really worth a try, especially if you like Poker and Blackjack. There is an active playerbase, a friend system, and always people running around the Casino to interact with.Card decks in this game are simulated realistically. If you use perfect strategy in multi-deck blackjack (or share info with your sneaky friends in VIP single-deck), you can effectively count cards like is possible in real life, minus the pit boss kicking you out of the casino. You can even watch other people playing and sit down at the table when you think the deck is "hot", but be careful because if someone else gets up the dealer will shuffle!What people don't realize, and why many reviews are negative, is that losing streaks are naturally much more common than people think. Things will happen like the dealer gets blackjack 2 or 3 times in a row and people will yell RIGGED!!! But if you play enough it is bound to happen in every game. People focus on the negatives, and when they win big they bet more and lose it quicker than they won it. All games have a house edge you won't win against in the long run, unless you count cards masterfully or play vs other players in Poker.I've gone broke dozens of times. When you go broke, every 15 minutes you can collect a little money from change machines. When waiting for this time to pass, the best thing to do is bother other players by humping them with your "awkward dance". The best players to do this to are the ones that have fallen asleep idling next to the change machines waiting for free money. You can also play bingo for free about once an hour, and poker once a day at a separate table for free money. There is also a little free daily money on top of this. It sounds easy, but earning a lot is a challenge.Once you have successfully clawed your way out of the loser salt mines, there is $5000 poker, and the elite "VIP" status can play $25000-entry poker. To reach VIP status, you have to earn enough "Rep" in one month. "Rep" is experience points you get from winning. You can use rep to unlock fancy clothes, effects, dances, pets, emotes, etc. VIP status gets you into the back room of high stakes tables, poker, and even fancier items! This way even though the house has an edge over you in probability, you can still progress in the game and can always dream of having a good enough run to make VIP. Other VIP's can give you temporary passes to get in as well.You can resurrect your empty bank account by paying real money if you want a quick escape from the salt mines, but it is not necessary. As a free-player I hit VIP the first month I tried, mostly through Poker wins. The Rep you earn can buy most of the vanity items you want if you don't mind waiting, and humping is free anyway.

content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								For early access I am very impressed. If you like casinos/casino games this is well done. The social interaction factor is a great addition. I can't wait to see what the future holds for this game. However, I am a bit concerned about the requirement in the VIP status section that states "minimum 30 day membership." For those of us who had enough faith in you to buy in as early access founders are you intending to charge a monthly membership fee? Considering your all in pass was almost as much as GTA V I think you would be making a critical error to charge founding members a monthly fee. Biting the hand that fed you could cause a rather nasty backlash. Example being what happened when Steam decided to allow charging a fee for Elder Scrolls V Skyrim mods. That really kicked the hornets’ nest and they quickly rescinded. Think about it gentlemen.

content:
Posted: October 21, 2016
												Let me first start by saying this game has a lot of potential and looks rather fun for the casual, and fulfilling for the needless end of gambling. i did not however try any of the other games other than blackjack, war, and then went to the poker room. the blackjack is run of the mill standard blackjack with fairly even odds from what i saw....So then i saw the poker room...I thought maybe this would be a place for underground poker adventures... First i would like to comment on the blinds for hold-em. The double every few minutes. so within ten minutes the blinds are at a staggering 4k-8k, which does not sound too bad untill you figure that you only start with 50k. With the blinds doubleing again in just moments you are putting more than 16k just to see the flop. These games are set up to be over very quickly. it turned out no matter how well you play texas hold-em, where everyone seldomly gets better than a pair. Once i had a three of a kind only to lose to someone with the same three of a kind and a high card. the reason i am now quiting is my final hand at the second texas hold-em "game".  I went all in pre-flop with a pocket pair of threes only to lose to the very same player mentioned earlier that had an ace of spades and a three of spades. the flop procedded as follows; a nine of spades, five of spades, and a jack of clubs. the turn happened to be a nine of clubs. the river was a five of diamonds. needless to say she won with a high card again. the poker is absolute BULLSH!T. basically what i am saying is the game is probably good, but play texas hold-em on any other game and it might be better for skilled players and less with luck.

content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
												Brilliant game if you want a secondlife type avatar and want to lose all your steam wallet balance, game starts you with 10k you will easily lose this, then you can get 150 coins every 15 mins, you will see people running around with pet avatars and boards saying the high payments people are winning however its clearly either made up or their making a fortune out of people who pay to play, the steam achievements seem more achievable if you have lots of money to fund your steam wallet, the higher stake you play in slots seem to decrease your chance of getting bonus round or free spins, in my case i was playing max at 2.750 spins and got 8 free spins and won 2000 coins which was less than my original wager.Purchasing chip packages just eats through your funds and well i went from having 50k chips to winning 30k chips but rather than it adding it to my balance my balance stayed the same and then on the 2nd time it happened i thought about reporting it but who would believe you the games have no transaction id and unless your recording your gameplay it's your word against theirs, even more so when you relise that once you pump your cash into the game there's no reverse option you can only put funds in they don't pay funds out to your steam balance or give you anything you can sell on the marketplace to re-coop your real cash spent.My advice avoid unless you like those facebook games that are usually free but have tons of microtransactions where you'll find yourself no better off than gambling for real!update 27/2/16The one thing that concerns me most about this game is it's setup, real casinos machines have minium payout requirements by law however since this game doesn't allow you to cashout any money you put in from your real bank account they do not have to provide any minium payout percentage per play.I could play the steam slots game at 3k a spin get 15 bonus spins and win 2k, plus every "big win" shows up even if i win double my wager, i do notice that the bonus rounds are more common when you play at 25 chips a spin.Besides having now real loyality as the VIP system is a bit of a joke so far ive spent £43 on this game thats pretty much over a million in game currency, everytime i buy currency and spend it on slots for example my balance just plummets you never seem to break even just gradually loss not even a raise on your gamble so to speak, so far considering how much i've spent of my real life cash im only on 86% to Vip lv1 and that just opens more games for me with higher stakes no good if i'm already losing.Yes you can get 250 free chips for free every 15 minutes but here's my next issues, min bet requirements, craps min 100, video poker 200 per play, poker 5k per game, bingo 5k per game, blackjack 100, keno 100/200, most of the games seem taylored around the 5k mark and for simply someone relaying on free chips this wouldn't be thesable even the daily taks require alot of spending for 200 chips per marked off task.I know i recently started a thread on refunds as so far ive lost approx 200k of chips due to technical issues however not been refunded this would sound far fetched for some users but when they look at my chip buy in history its only a little drop compared to what ive been spending, i think i seriously need to back off spending real life cash i can't afford it considering gambling for real would cost around the same the only difference is you can withdraw your cash plus they offer real loyality schemes which don't require you to spend more money once you get the loyality requirements.I think with the current loyality structure + achievements for steam you would have to be playing for years or spend thousands of your own money in rl just to achieve them compared to other social steam games which cost £5 to buy and have severs too, i'm not sure if steam even properly converts the players real life spend to reflect how much money is being pumped in but £42.99 is €54.55 or $60 or $80.59 CAD

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												I've been reading some of the reviews lately and I honestly don't understand why a lot of people dislike this game. I understand that there can be some compatibility issues within the game, and a list of bugs (especially when it's in early access) but honestly, the whole atmosphere/environment in this game is great.Obviously, if you're not into games a casino would feature (like poker, blackjack, 6wheel, slots etc) then you'll probably not like this game. But with the features included in this game, such as the limited freeroam offered within a virtual-type casino is quite unique and it gives some quality to the game. This game reminds me of the good old playstation home, it's really nice. I've already invited a handful of friends to play the game with me and they've also enjoyed it. So far, the players within the community are all quite mature and are really enjoying the game. Although I would like to see if there is some kind of forum or website where you can hand out some suggestions or help in regards to playing the game. If by any chance, someone does have a link, I would appreciate if someone would send me the link.Anyways, great game guys, I recommend it!

content:
Posted: August 1, 2015
												The game is still going through a rough patch where you can run into some seriously game-breaking bugs, but they are quick to shut down areas of the casino that are effected and then patch it within a day. That being said, they WILL reimburse any chips that you lost to bugs if you send in a ticket, contrary to what many other reviews have claimed.But aside from the bugs, the game is really quite solid. Most of the time all the games and machines work perfectly fine, and the variety is good. They also run tournaments periodically for when you're feeling a bit more competitive.So what's the bad then? Since the game is free, they'll try to coax you into buying chips with real money. Now, you're never forced into a situation where buying chips is the only way to continue playing, but if you go broke often it will definitely test your patience. In order to get free chips, you can do both daily and weekly tasks that reward you with chips. After that, you get one Super Slot spin per day. And if you're really desperate, you can collect free chips from an ATM every 15 minutes. But beyond that the game is reasonably generous. When you win chips, you also slowly build up premium currency. You can win your way into the VIP lounge by playing enough, and many of the cosmetics can be attained by earning achievments.The social elements of the game feel somewhat forced but that's true of most MMO-styled games.Overall, if you like casino games, you can't go wrong giving this a try.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								Very basic sim with very little excitement.  Might be better with consistent players, but probably not much.  All the games are very generic, without any of the themes or personality that make casinos fun.The poker room is pretty disappointing, and I don't see any sign in the early access notes of there being plans for any sort of major overhaul here. It's not at all like an actual casino poker room, and seems like it's been designed by someone who doesn't know much about poker. There is no cash games, only sit-and-go style tournaments with extremely fast blind levels that tend to turn the game into an all-in festival within minutes. There is no variety in games. The tables don't even have enough seats for a typical casino poker game. The poker setup seems geared toward getting games over with as quickly as possible.

												5/5 Stars. It is a great game free or not. There is a nice social aspect and a wide variety of games for people to play. I also enjoy how the game tells you the rules of the games. content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												My first review was a little harsh, cause I didn't really give the game enough time. I've played it a few more times since, and I have to say its not bad for a newly release game.However, I have ran into a few issues while trying to join table. The game will tell me that I have joined the table chat, and then I am stuck standing next to the table. Once I try to leave the table the game tells me that I have chips in play, and that if I leave I will lose those chips. That is the only real issue I have ran into as far as game play goes.I've seen some reviews that have people complaining about the micro transactions, but compared to most games, I would say that they are very fair.Would like to see some diversity in the future as far as the slot machines, table limits, and daily prizes.For being a newly released game, I would say that overall it has some true potential, and it's FREE! Can't really beat that.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 22, 2016
												Just a few thoughts...Table Card Games: Good - as usual, a computer-controlled Dealer is always suspect due to the number of 'lucky' hands at just the wrong time for the Human players.Slots: Tight most of the time; stingy Bonus payouts.  These Slots could be *much* better if Players could have some interactive control over the spinning wheels.  A One-Click option to set the wheels slowing into a final landing for that spin. And/Or a Two-Click option that stops the wheels immediately.  Practice, intuition and a fast, well-chosen click would add a much-needed interactive element to these slots.  Also; change out the slot 'themes' from time to time.Other Machine Games: Okay - higher non-VIP wager limits wouldn't hurt.  Add some newer games, progressive pots, etc.Poker and Bingo are the best games here for 'avatar-to-avatar' interaction; the Poses, Emotes and other in-game actions are fun, but lag-time often ruins the timing.  Be nice if we could group a few movements together as a Macro, coupled with some pre-written text, for a 'custom-crafted' greeting.  Add BreakDancing for competitions between Ava's and some other Dance forms.Clothing, Appearance, Objects: all fun and a nice touch for the overall appearance and ambience.  Keyboard and Mouse IF are good, too.  Low stress on the fingers over extended periods.Overall: A good representaion of a Casino & Nightclub with earned VIP perks, a fun place to hang with some friends and gamble, chat and socialize.  There are stores for purchasing clothes and some wild effects, animal and critter companions, and a place where you can buy a trip with your friends to a Space Station. Lotsa gaming there, I hear.Worth your time for some light entertainment, cards and gambling.  And a free Hotel room, too.They're calling another Progressive Bingo game right now; big bucks on this one - gotta run!~Max

content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
												NIce concept--games are fairly easy to get into and out of once you get the hang of the UI.  Decent options to gain free chips for completing various tasks (and you get 250 chips every 15 minutes just for being in game)--you can also buy chips fairly inexpensively if you like as well.Only thing I wish they would add are cash games in the poker room instead of the turbo sit-and-go tournament format--since I really enjoy playing poker in real casinos this would add a lot to the game for me.No real bugs for me yet and it's free to play, so go ahead and give this game a try.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
												I'll definitely recommend this to anyone who's a fan of the casino ... or at least the games you play in it.From slot machines to video poker and blackjack, to real tables of poker, blackjack, and even bingo, this game has a lot of games to play.Of course, this game does have microtransactions where you can purchase chips for yourself or your friends, plus microtransactions for some clothing items in the shops (should you like to customize your character), but it's not too bad.  I think this game pulled it off without a hitch in that regard.Unfortunately, this game is a little buggy, even out of early access.  So far, I've filed three bug reports regarding minor things in the game, but it's nothing that'll ruin your experience, and the developers update the game very quick, so you have to respect that!TL;DR: Play at the casino without using your own money = no bankruptcy.
